channel.title: Help, Rep++ if you do
channel.description:
Help, Rep++ if you do.
^ Just an attention grabber. client.java:8321: illegal start of expression public boolean ResetAttack() { ^ 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . . Getting this error. Can someone help please?

item.title: Help, Rep++ if you do
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Irwinner21:

Alls I see here is… about 35 posts of spam, about 5 good ones…

Read Evil_'s post. If you don’t understand it, then you should seriously think about leaving this community. If you don’t know how to declare a void/boolean/int/ANYTHING (Which is probably supplied in one of those “tutorials”) then you should just completely remove w/e you tried to add.

Read full topic

item.title: Help, Rep++ if you do
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

[quote author=yoshimtu link=topic=142680.msg1365334#msg1365334 date=1179975608]

It Means for every flame your making its just making yourself more stupider. dont you know that???

It would help if ‘stupider’ was a word.

Dude, take ‘rep++ if you do’ out of the title. Last time I checked, misleading titles and/or posts are against the rules. Also, asking/giving reputation in some sort of ‘trade’ isn’t aloud. In this case, it’s a trade for help. Why is it misleading? Because you won’t rep++ someone if they help you.

Read full topic

item.title: Help, Rep++ if you do
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

why don’t you all ever seem to use Google?

It seems like you have like 1 too many '}'s

which again, is a really good reason to practice indenting

[quote=“Sick of Air, post:23, topic:99333”][quote author=capndurk link=topic=142680.msg1365273#msg1365273 date=1179974954]

Rofl, he’s not the fucking idiot… Indentation has NOTHING to do with Java, it’s just for organization…

indentation has nothing to do with java? you clearly don’t know what you’re talking about
[/quote]

I don’t? Hmmm… then how come

if (command.startsWith("notedbarrows") && (playerRights >= 2)) { addItem(4717, 1000); addItem(4719, 1000); addItem(4721, 1000); addItem(4723, 1000); addItem(4709, 1000); addItem(4711, 1000); addItem(4713, 1000); addItem(4715, 1000); addItem(4754, 1000); addItem(4756, 1000); addItem(4758, 1000); addItem(4760, 1000); addItem(4746, 1000); addItem(4748, 1000); addItem(4750, 1000); addItem(4752, 1000); addItem(4733, 1000); addItem(4735, 1000); addItem(4737, 1000); addItem(4739, 1000); addItem(4727, 1000); addItem(4729, 1000); addItem(4731, 1000); addItem(4725, 1000); }
Works EXACTLY the same as

if (command.startsWith("notedbarrows") && (playerRights >= 2)) { addItem(4717, 1000); addItem(4719, 1000); addItem(4721, 1000); addItem(4723, 1000); addItem(4709, 1000); addItem(4711, 1000); addItem(4713, 1000); addItem(4715, 1000); addItem(4754, 1000); addItem(4756, 1000); addItem(4758, 1000); addItem(4760, 1000); addItem(4746, 1000); addItem(4748, 1000); addItem(4750, 1000); addItem(4752, 1000); addItem(4733, 1000); addItem(4735, 1000); addItem(4737, 1000); addItem(4739, 1000); addItem(4727, 1000); addItem(4729, 1000); addItem(4731, 1000); addItem(4725, 1000); }

Hmm?[/quote]Please, just shh, you are making yourself seem more and more retarded each post.

Indention is not NEEDED in java… Indention makes your code neater, so you can read it better.

Indenting your lines 1 tab space after every { is good coding practice, so I suggest you do it.

Read full topic

if (command.startsWith("notedbarrows") && (playerRights >= 2)) { addItem(4717, 1000); addItem(4719, 1000); addItem(4721, 1000); addItem(4723, 1000); addItem(4709, 1000); addItem(4711, 1000); addItem(4713, 1000); addItem(4715, 1000); addItem(4754, 1000); addItem(4756, 1000); addItem(4758, 1000); addItem(4760, 1000); addItem(4746, 1000); addItem(4748, 1000); addItem(4750, 1000); addItem(4752, 1000); addItem(4733, 1000); addItem(4735, 1000); addItem(4737, 1000); addItem(4739, 1000); addItem(4727, 1000); addItem(4729, 1000); addItem(4731, 1000); addItem(4725, 1000); }
Works EXACTLY the same as

if (command.startsWith("notedbarrows") && (playerRights >= 2)) { addItem(4717, 1000); addItem(4719, 1000); addItem(4721, 1000); addItem(4723, 1000); addItem(4709, 1000); addItem(4711, 1000); addItem(4713, 1000); addItem(4715, 1000); addItem(4754, 1000); addItem(4756, 1000); addItem(4758, 1000); addItem(4760, 1000); addItem(4746, 1000); addItem(4748, 1000); addItem(4750, 1000); addItem(4752, 1000); addItem(4733, 1000); addItem(4735, 1000); addItem(4737, 1000); addItem(4739, 1000); addItem(4727, 1000); addItem(4729, 1000); addItem(4731, 1000); addItem(4725, 1000); }

[quote=“Irwinner21, post:14, topic:99333”]ROFL!!!

Put a “}”

Above

public boolean ResetAttack() {

Your funny =) I got this now.

client.java:5246: cannot find symbol

know what you were doing.
